page.title: 04EVENTS-NEWARK SHOW
page.content: Newark and Nottinghamshire{Show}is held in May on an 84 acre site on what was formerly Winthorpe{Airfield. The event is organised by Show Secretaries,Mr.and Mrs.N.J.Armitage, who work throughout the year contacting over 400 exhibitors nationwide,arranging for judges and show jumping competition entries. In 1985,62,000 people visited the show which included livestock and machinery exhibits,showjumping ,band concerts,and a variety of stalls and sideshows.The Agricultural Society, which owns the site,employs permanently one office secretery.A groundsman,assisted part-time by 4 youths,is responsible for maintenance and preparation for numerous other shows held there during the year. The site is also used for{recreation} such as gliding,model planes and golf.
